review: I own a Roku 2 as well. Its the exact same thing its just cheaper and smaller! I haven't put too many hours into this guy yet but its sure is doing its job right now.One thing to consider: Your TV!I bought a TV and the Roku streaming stick at the same time off amazon because I wanted to watch nexflix in my bedroom. My plan was to mount my TV on the wall. The streaming stick seemed simple: No box no wires! I didn't even think about where, how many, or what kind of HDMI ports were on the TV I just bought a highly rated cheap TV because I was only using it with a Roku.Well the Roku streaming stick needs power. If your HDMI port is powered you're in luck!! No need for the AC adaptor.  Now if if you HDMI port is not powered, it needs to be plugged in to a power source with the AC adaptor, which means another cord and another thing in a outlet. :(I also didn't think about the placement of the HDMI outputs on my TV. My TV only has two and they stick straight out of the back. Thankfully my streaming stick just barely cleared the wall mount but I have to be thoughtful of the streaming stick when pushing my tv against the wall because it sticks so far out of the TV. Now also add the power cord and the TV has to be at least 5 inches from the wall, where i was hoping for it to be flush.
